greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers n such that n concatenated with n-4 gives the product of two numbers which differ by 4.
comment: Contains, and appears to be identical to, A116098.
Numbers n such that (10^d+1)*n is a square, where n-4 has d digits. (End)
maple: if a^2 < c then a:= a+1 fi;
if b^2 > c then b:= b-1 fi;
results.author: _Giovanni Resta_, Feb 06 2006
